column4: Hi. My sandisk sd card can't be readed/formatted (not locked)... 12.04 detects it but can't do anything. The SD card is the issue. How to recover it?
Can you see it using 'sudo fdisk -l'  ?
yes pal. I can see it. http://pastebin.com/Jp1Nw04T
I used to have a recovery software on Vista for cases like these. But I don't remember the name and run ubuntu only
is the sd card really formatted with a linux file system ? (Apart from sda needing a partition table fix fdisk says the sd card is a linux filesystem)
so partition type 83 is plausible, right?
what happens if you give 'sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/sdb1 /mnt'
did you try to mount the card? (see above for command) Any error messages ?
One sec. Almost there. Had an issue with my terminal
http://pastebin.com/r3vwJCzF
'sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/sdb1 /mnt'  ... no typos allowed
Now i was able to format it back to fat 32 but I can't open it.
your command was wrong
ok... so you don't want to recover data, you just want to reformat it and have an empty drive ?
Yes.
ahhh ... thats easy
i want to be able to use it. It's formated to fat32 on gparted... but man, I can't write or read it. it's not locked
first of all lets get rid of all the junk: sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sdb bs=4k
say when it's done ...
sorry about that but my sistem crashed when I introduced the last instructions you gave me

what the command did is overwriting /dev/sdb (the SD-card) with zeroes. if your system crashes when doing so it might be a hardware issue. Here's the command again: sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sdb bs=4k  be sure to run it on the correct device... it nukes everything there
